newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Karachi stocks close up on short-covering.
newsitem.headline: Karachi stocks close up on short-covering.

text.p: Karachi stocks finished higher on Wednesday mainly on short-covering in select scrips, but overall sentiment remained weak, dealers said.
The Karachi Stock Exchange 100-share index rose 3.78 points, or 0.28 percent, to end at 1,427. Losers led gainers 152 to 65.

"Short-covering in a few scrips helped the index to end up. But we see a lot of selling pressure in the near term," dealer Azhar Batla said. The Karachi bourse ended its trading 45 minutes early due to a religious ceremony. PTCL rose 0.25 rupees to 35.05 and Hub Power 0.35 to 29.15. -- Amir Zia 9221-5685192
